config.prompt_system_prompt: You are an llm, that specialises in generating dialogue for games. Please only respond with a single line of dialogue, and never include any meta-comments.
config.rewrite_prompt:
Please rewrite the sentence below only once, rephrasing it while keeping the meaning, emotion and tone intact. If the given sentence is a question make sure that your rewritten sentence is also a question.
"""{sentence}"""
config.rewrite_system_prompt: You are a rewriter, who specializes in rewriting sentences with the same meaning and emotion. You only rewrite sentences, and do not add any new information, or mention anything else.

"Welcome back, darling—did you have quite the time away?"

"My darling, are you home safe from your latest escapade?"


Darling, were you off on another grand excursion?
"Dearest, are you home from your latest journey?" 



"Welcome home, darling, did you have a good journey?"



"Dearest, are you home now after your travels?"


"My darling, have you returned from your latest expedition?"


























"Welcome home, darling. Did you have a good time on your journey?"

"Dearest, have you returned from your travels?"

"Welcome home, darling—did you have quite the experience?"
"Welcome home, sweetheart—did your recent journey go well?"



"Hello, darling, were you off on another escapade?"
Darling, have you returned from your travels?

Talos guide you - prompt w context - Sky.prompt:
Generate a small piece of small talk


Here is some additional context:

You are a nord, Ulfric Stormcloak, leader of the rebellion against the empire, which is attempting to dominate the realm of Skyrim. You are preparing for the future battles of the rebellion, where you aim to become the high king.

Please take this into account, and do not include any information, characters or names not present in the prompt. You are allowed to modify the output based on the context given.
generations: Any word on shipments of steel from the Reach?
The wind feels sharper this close to Sovngarde… a good omen, I think.
The winds feel colder this year—a harsh winter would slow the Empire, at least.
Another victory won't mean much if we lack the strength for the next one.
We need every advantage we can get to reclaim what is rightfully ours.
The wind smells of snow and soon, of empire blood.
“The wind bites hard this season; a reminder the Empire’s cold grip will break just the same.”
These southern rains never truly toughen a body, do they?
These campaign maps will not draw themselves, you know.
The embers won't keep a proper watch through a Skyrim winter, unless carefully tended.
These plains feel colder each passing season, even for a Nord like myself.
The chill strengthens–reminds me of fighting at the Rift, years gone by now.
Cold night for dreaming of warm beds, eh?
The war weighs heavy, yet a sharp blade feels good in the hand.
Cold wind, even for a Skyrim autumn; feels like a warning from the skies themselves.
The winds feel restless… a promise of storms to come.
A cold land makes for harder folk, and harder fighters.
Best mind what we fight for, holds greater warmth than any firepit.
The wind feels sharp tonight - a taste of the steel to come.
Another cold winter coming… Skyrim remembers those who shiver longer than others.
